summary: A woman shares tips on how to travel the world on an extreme budget, emphasizing that she does not have a sugar daddy or a trust fund but knows how to make her money stretch. She explains that travelers can find free accommodation by signing up for websites like Trusted House Sitters and Worldpackers, which allow them to do work exchanges or house-sit for people who are out of town. This, she states, eliminates the biggest expense of travel. Due to time constraints, she mentions she will post a part two.
transcript: If you're broke but you really wanna travel the world listen up. I'm Maddie I'm 24 and I'm a full-time traveler who spent over 50 countries traveling on an extreme budget and I'm gonna show you how you can do that too. And no I don't have a sugar daddy. No I don't have a trust fund but instead I just really know how to make my money stretch the furthest and you know I'm gonna give you all this information here on TikTok for free. Travelers help travelers learn new things. I definitely didn't have enough money to pay $200 for a master class. I wanted to spend that on a flight and I believe everyone should be able to see the world. Save this video to look back at to plan your trip! Make sure you save this video for when you want to plan your next trip. Now I'm talking extreme budget. Step one: land FREE accommodation. The first thing we're gonna get sorted is your accommodation. We want that to be free. Yes free, I know. But you can do this by signing up for websites like Trusted House Sitters and Worldpackers to either do work exchanges or watch someone's home while they're out of town. This completely wipes out your number one biggest expense. Okay, didn't realize how short I was running on time so I'll make a part 2 and post it right away.
